result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon D. Hughes

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Preliminary Examination, Arraignment, Plea/Sentencing Hearing 9-26-22

1:12 PM Defendant Brandon D. Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Brandon D. Hughes.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  State notes victim notification rights have been met in all cases and there is nothing further to provide.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim in 22CF339 only.  Atty Duren waives prelim, as does DE.  Court questions DE on waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over in 22CF339.  State states the joint rec as to all 3 cases.  Atty Duren is in agreement and acknowledges rec. information in 22CF339 and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges max penalties of that doc and enters NG pleas at this time.  Atty Duren enters NC pleas to Count 1 in each of 22CF272 and 22CF339.  DE also pleads NC.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court advises DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  State makes statement.  Atty Duren makes statement.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

22CF155 is dismissed/read-in

22CF272
Ct 1:  NC 
Cts 2-6:  Dismissed/read-in

22CF339
Ct 1:  NC 
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in

2 years prison (1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision) concurrent to each other but consecutive to any others
DE would be eligible for SAP and CIP
$518.00 in 22CF272 and $528.00 in 22CF339 costs/surcharges
DNA samples to be provided
Conditions of extended supervision:
Absolute sobriety at all times
No possession of any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription
If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it. 
AODA and any recommended follow up treatment/counseling per agent
Must notify agent if prescription rec'd w/in 24 hours

***All remaining counts are dismissed/read-in

Final pre-trial on October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Atty Duren received and waives reading of Information.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Atty Duren stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, to be set for TSC in about 60 days.  Bond continues.

10:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon D. Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Brandon D. Hughes. Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.

8:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon D. Hughes in court, in custody.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Brandon D. Hughes.  Atty. Blake Duren appeared by telephone.  Atty Duren requests matter be set for preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return date on May 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No possession of any type of knives or dangerous weapons

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on April 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.

02:39 PM Defendant Brandon D. Hughes in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Hayes.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon D. Hughes appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $250 Cash bond w/conditions. Atty. Hayes requests signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No possession of any type of knives or dangerous weapons.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
